INTRODUCTION

Hue traditional music is a special art of Hue ancient capital city. It consists of over eighty melodies of the folk music, the chamber music, anh the court music â€“ ten continuous pieces of which called â€œmÆ°á»i báº£n ngá»±â€ are used for instrumental ensembles. Concerning Hue chamber music, there exist more than twenty four well â€“ known works of two different modes â€“ the North and the South â€“ namely â€œCá»• báº£n, LÆ°u thá»§y, Lá»™ng Ä‘iá»‡p, Pháº©m tuyáº¿t, Nam bÃ¬nh, Nam ai, TÆ°Æ¡ng tÆ°, Tá»© Ä‘áº¡i cáº£nh, PhÃº lá»¥c, HÃ nh vÃ¢nâ€¦, and the forth. With regards to the folk music, there are numerous tunes of â€œhÃ²â€ such as â€œHÃ² mÃ¡i nhÃ¬, HÃ² giÃ£ gáº¡o, etc. and such other pieces as â€œLÃ½ tÃ¬nh tang, (LÃ½ mÆ°á»i thÆ°Æ¡ng), LÃ½ hoÃ i nam, LÃ½ ngá»±a Ã´, LÃ½ nÄƒm canh, LÃ½ giao duyÃªn, LÃ½ tá»­ vi, LÃ½ quá»³nh tÆ°Æ¡ng, LÃ½ con sÃ¡o, LÃ½ tiá»ƒu khÃºcâ€, and so on. Hue chamber Music on Huong River is a unipue art style producing the marvelous harmony among human, music, and the poetic scenry of Huong River.
